text: William Cecil Campbell (born 28 June 1930) is an Irish-born American biologist and parasitologist. He is known for his work in discovering a novel therapy against infections caused by roundworms. He won the 2015 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. He helped to discover a class of drugs called ivermectins. Campbell worked at the Merck Institute for Therapeutic Research and is currently a research fellow emeritus at Drew University. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:Living people Category:Irish scientists Category:American biologists Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Drew University faculty
title: William C. Campbell (scientist)
